page.title: 01Crayke Village
page.content:
People call Crayke a village on a hill. It is very quiet and peaeful. It has got nice cottages and houses. The vilalge green is very attractive especially in the spring with the swaying daffodils.
The people who live here are very friendly. They are mainly country people who have lived here nearly all their life. Some people come to Crayke to retire.
Crayke is an agricultural village The fields go all around Crayke, and farming is the most common job here.
The villagers shop at the Post Office and get some food at Dobson's van. Easingwold is the nearest town for petrol and other things. There is a garage that does repairs but it doesnt
